data.title: G.P. PUTNAM DEAD; RETIRED PUBLISHER; Husband of Amelia Earhart, Flier Lost at Sea in 1937, Was Author and Explorer

G.P. PUTNAM DEAD; RETIRED PUBLISHER; Husband of Amelia Earhart, Flier Lost at Sea in 1937, Was Author and Explorer

Jan. 5, 1950

See the article in its original context from

January 5, 1950 , Page 25Buy Reprints

TimesMachine is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers.

Full text is unavailable for this digitized archive article. Subscribers may view the full text of this article in its original form through TimesMachine.

TRONA, Calif., Jan. 4--George Palmer Putnam, retired publisher and husband of Amelia Earhart, famous flier, when she was lost at sea in the Pacific, died this morning at Trona Hospital of uremic poisoning after a month's illness. His age was 63. View Full Article in Timesmachine Â»
